Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

decahedral BiVO 4 (Figure S7b), indicating the staggered ZnIn 2 S 4 nanosheet is of a restrictive effect on CO 2 gas absorption. 3.2.Photocatalytic Performance.Photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 into fuel using solar energy is an effective strategy to solve the problem of global warming and energy shortage.The photocatalytic experiment was performed with the participation of deionized water under simulated solar irradiation.The major product of all photocatalysts is detected to be CO with a small amount of

lead to decreasing catalytic activities.Nevertheless, the catalytic activities may be recovered through post annealing treatment of the photocatalyst.The O 2 output was also close to the stoichiometric molar ratio of CO to O 2 .In the case of dark conditions or the absence of photocatalyst, no CO or CH 4 product was detected, which proves that the CO 2 conversion is driven by illumination under the action of the photocatalyst.A blank experiment was conducted under the same conditions without the

to be CO with a small amount of CH 4 (Figure 3a,b).The photoexcited holes in the valence band oxidize H 2 O to create hydrogen ions via the formula of H 2 O 12O 2 2H 2e -.The electrons in the CB reduce CO 2 to CO and CH 4 by the formula of CO 2 2e - 2H CO H 2 O and CO 2 8e - 8H CH 4 2H 2 O. result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: the system to reach the ambient pressure.Subsequently, 0.4 mL of purified water was injected into the reactor as a reducing agent.The solar simulator is a 300 W xenon lamp.During the reaction process, the temperature of the system atmosphere was always maintained at normal temperature through the circulating cooling water device.One milliliter of gas was extracted from the reactor every hour.The product is analyzed by a gas chromatograph (GC-2014, Shimadzu Corp., Japan).The simulated irradiation time is 5

states were inspected by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS; K-Alpha, Thermo Fisher Scientific).Surface photovoltage spectroscopy (SPV) was tested by a photoassisted Kelvin probe force microscopy (KPFM) with PX Ultra Controller (NT-MDT).A fluorescence decay spectrum with a spectrometer was recorded at 422 nm (F-4600, Hitachi Instruments, Japan).The signal of O 2 -and OH was examined by electron spinresonance spectroscopy (ESR) technique (EXM-1012, Bruker, GER).A photoelectrochemical test was carried out

test was carried out via a CHI660E workstation with a normative three-electrode cell in 1 mM NaSO 4 solution. 2.3.Measurement of Photocatalytic Activity.The reduction experiment was implemented at room temperature.Typically, the asprepared powders (0.1 g) were evenly spread on the bottom of the reactor.The area of the sample glass guide channel is approximately 4.91 cm 2 .The airtight reaction system was repeatedly evacuated, and finally high-purity CO 2 gas was entered into the system to reach the ambient

the same conditions without the participation of CO 2 , and no CO or CH 4 products were found, confirming that the carbon source was entirely derived from the imported CO 2 .In addition, the crystallo- graphic phase and morphology of the ZnIn 2 S 4 BiVO 4 heterojunction did not change before and after simulated solar irradiation, which proves the good durability of this catalyst (Figure S8). 3.3.Reasons for Excellent Photocatalytic Performance.The prerogative of composite materials also allows photoexcited

2.2.Characterizations.The crystallographic phase was studied using the X-ray diffractometer (XRD; Rigaku Ultima III, Japan).The morphology was characterized by field-emission scanning electron microscopy (FESEM, FEI NOVA NANOSEM 230).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and fine resolution TEM were taken on a JEM 200CX TEM apparatus.The ultraviolet-visible light absorption spectrum was depicted by a UV-vis spectrophotometer (UV-2550, Shimadzu).The chemical element states were inspected by X-ray
